tern
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • response_table

Wrap data generated from chgfbl_data into rtable format, to create a test result and change from baseline by visit summary table

Wrap data generated from chgfbl_data into rtable format, to create a test result and change from baseline by visit summary table

chgfbl_table(data)

Arguments

data

data generated by chgfbl_data function

Examples


library(tern)
library(random.cdisc.data)

ASL <- radam("ASL")

ANL <- merge(ASL, radam("AQS", ADSL = ASL)) %>%
   filter(PARAMCD == "FATIGI")

df <- chgfbl_data(data = ANL)
chgfbl_table(df)
#>                        ARM A                 ARM A                 ARM B                 ARM B     
#>                    Value at Visit         Change from          Value at Visit         Change from  
#>                        (N=43)               Baseline               (N=57)               Baseline   
#>                                              (N=43)                                      (N=57)    
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> WEEK 1
#>   n                      43                                          57                            
#>   Mean (SD)           -0.1 (1)                                     0 (1)                           
#>   Median                 0                                          -0.1                           
#>   IQR               -0.99 - 0.64                                -0.54 - 0.69                       
#>   Min - Max         -1.92 - 1.84                                -2.46 - 2.79                       
#> 
#> WEEK 2
#>   n                      43                    43                    57                    57      
#>   Mean (SD)           -0.2 (1)             -0.1 (1.5)            -0.1 (1.2)             0 (1.5)    
#>   Median                -0.1                   0                    -0.2                  -0.2     
#>   IQR               -0.75 - 0.23          -0.97 - 0.89          -0.97 - 0.69          -0.98 - 1.47 
#>   Min - Max         -2.45 - 1.94          -3.91 - 3.68          -1.88 - 3.59          -3.21 - 3.24 
#> 
#> WEEK 3
#>   n                      38                    38                    50                    50      
#>   Mean (SD)           -0.2 (1)             -0.1 (1.7)             -0.1 (1)              0 (1.7)    
#>   Median                -0.1                  -0.2                  -0.2                  -0.2     
#>   IQR                -1 - 0.42            -1.63 - 1.21          -0.61 - 0.39          -1.27 - 1.28 
#>   Min - Max         -2.32 - 1.48          -3.6 - 3.26           -2.21 - 2.45          -2.68 - 4.14 
#>
